Search Password Managers
Search the database of password managers to see legacy functionality

Results

1Password

Emergency Kit
Password Sharing
Account Recovery
Overview
Website: https://1password.com/
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: Yes
Password sharing functionality: Yes
Emergency Kit Functionality
What's this?
Contents of the emergency kit:
  • Sign in address
  • Email address
  • Secret Key
  • Option to write your master password
  • QR code
Emergency Kit Documentation
Password Sharing Functionality
  • Password sharing is only available to users part of Families, Teams, Business or Enterprise subscriptions
  • Passwords are shared via shared vaults, which contain copies of credentials
Password Sharing Documentation
Account Recovery Functionality
Applicable subscriptions:
  • Teams
  • Families
Requirements:
  • Access to user's email inbox
  • Recover Accounts permission
Account Recovery Documentation
Export formats
  • csv
  • txt
  • 1pif (1Password 4 only)
Notes
  • If you have a membership with 1password or belong to a family or team account, your emergency kit will contain your secret key, and a place to write your master password. Learn more about what your secret key is here: https://support.1password.com/secret-key/
  • You may want to keep a copy of the emergency kit (with master password) with your will, or give it to someone you trust.
  • You may want to keep your master password written somewhere separate to your secret key

Apple Keychain

Overview
Website: https://support.apple.com/en-gb/HT204085
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: Partial
Password Sharing Functionality
  • Items can be shared over airdrop only (only to other Apple devices, over WiFi or Bluetooth)
  • Credentials can only be shared individually, not as part of a shared folder
Password Sharing Documentation
Export formats
  • Encrypted file only usable by Apple Keychain
Notes
  • Some workarounds have been developed to export passwords to .csv format, for example see this thread: https://gist.github.com/rmondello/b933231b1fcc83a7db0b
  • Third-party apps may be available to assist in exporting passwords into shareable formats, for example see this article: https://appletoolbox.com/easily-export-your-passwords-from-icloud-keychain-with-this-script/

Ascendo DataVault

Overview
Website: http://ascendo.co/support.html
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Export formats
  • 'Standard text formats'
Notes
  • There is functionality to backup passwords onto Dropbox. It may be possible to backup to a shared folder and leave the password to this file in a safe place to be passed to the executor of the will or other assigned data steward

Avast Passwords

Overview
Website: https://support.avast.com/en-gb/article/Passwords-FAQ
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Export formats
  • To .csv via Google Chrome (using unofficial workaround: https://support.avast.com/en-gb/article/Export-Google-Chrome-Passwords-data)
Notes

Blackberry Password Keeper

Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Export formats
  • csv
Notes

Blur Passwords

Overview
Website: https://dnt.abine.com/#feature/passwords
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: Partial
Password sharing functionality: No
Emergency Kit Functionality
What's this?
Contents of the emergency kit:
  • Backup passphrase
Emergency Kit Documentation
Export formats
  • csv
Notes
  • Blur provides a locally generated backup passphrase that can be used to restore access to the account. Use of this feature requires both the knowledge of the passphrase and also access to the user's email inbox. As such, use of this feature to provide emergency or post-mortem access will require email access/credentials to be made available separately as well.

Bitwarden

Overview
Website: https://bitwarden.com/
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Export formats
  • JSON
  • csv
Notes
  • Emergency contact functionality is a requested feature, and the progress can be tracked here: https://community.bitwarden.com/t/emergency-access/115/69. Given the popularity of the request, it is likely the feature will be implemented in the near future.

  • json
  • xml
Notes

Dashlane

Emergency Contact
Password Sharing
Account Recovery
Overview
Website: https://www.dashlane.com/
Emergency contact functionality: Yes
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: Yes
Emergency Contact Functionality
Mechanism: Dead man's switch of optional length initiated by emergency contact
Granularity: Full access to all credentials by default, which can be optionally limited to specific credentials
Objects that can be passed:
  • Credentials
  • Secure Notes
Number of contacts possible: One or more
Types of accounts that can give access: Any
Types of accounts that can receive access: Any
Emergency Contact Documentation
Password Sharing Functionality
  • Non-premium users are limited to 5 shared passwords with each other user, while premium users have unlimited sharing.
  • The credentials can be shared with full or limited rights. Limited rights restricts the ability to see, edit or share the password, but this is enforced by the Dashlane client and can be worked around by a determined users.
Password Sharing Documentation
Account Recovery Functionality
Applicable subscriptions:
  • Business
Requirements:
  • Access to user's email inbox
  • Access to a previously authenticated device
  • Admin access to the Business group
  • Account Recovery must have been enabled
  • User must not have opted out
Account Recovery Documentation
Export formats
  • json
  • csv
  • Proprietary Dashlane format
Notes
  • Guidance on adding an emergency contact is available here: https://support.dashlane.com/hc/en-us/articles/360008918959
  • Guidance on requesting emergency access is available here: https://support.dashlane.com/hc/en-us/articles/360008918999
  • Dashlane Business account recovery is optional for privacy reasons, and can be turned off in the settings

Enpass

Overview
Website: https://www.enpass.io/
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Export formats
  • json
Notes

EveryKey

Password Sharing
Overview
Website: https://everykey.com/
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: Yes
Password Sharing Functionality
Password Sharing Documentation
Export formats
  • Unknown
Notes
  • EveryKey features a hardware component which is designed to unlock the password manager remotely by bluetooth when within range. This device can be frozen remotely when lost/stolen, but in the case of incapacitation or death, it may potentially still be used as a means of accessing the user's password vault.

F-Secure KEY

Account Recovery
Overview
Website: https://www.f-secure.com/en/home/products/key
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Account Recovery Functionality
Applicable subscriptions:
  • All
Requirements:
  • On each device, F-Secure Key will allow you to create an encrypted image to be used to recover access to your master password. This image cannot be used to do so on a device that has already been connected to the F-Secure Key account.
  • Based on the support documentation, no other information is needed, meaning that access to a connected device with a recovery image may be enough for the master password to be discovered. See here: https://community.f-secure.com/discussion/81209/how-do-i-recover-my-f-secure-key-master-password-on-my-desktop-device
Account Recovery Documentation
Export formats
  • fsk
Notes

Firefox Lockwise

Overview
Website: https://www.mozilla.org/en-GB/firefox/lockwise/
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Account Recovery Functionality
Applicable subscriptions:
  • All
Requirements:
  • Setting a master password is optional. If a user is using Sync and has not set a master password, access to Firefox is sufficient to access the passwords. It appears (unofficially), as of 11/03/2020, that resetting the main sync password via email password reset is sufficient to log in and access saved logins and passwords.
Account Recovery Documentation
Export formats
  • csv
  • json
Notes

Google Chrome

Account Recovery
Overview
Website: https://passwords.google.com/
Emergency contact functionality: No
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: No
Account Recovery Functionality
Applicable subscriptions:
  • All
Requirements:
  • Access to recovery information depending on account setup. This could include access/information such as recovery phone number, recovery email, security questions or other information that Google may use to confirm identity
Account Recovery Documentation
Export formats
  • csv
Notes
  • Google has a bespoke dead man's switch solution for inactive accounts, however this does not extend to passwords stored by the browser.
  • Google has an additional option to add a Sync passphrase to your account. A user who has done this will need to use this password to authorise any new accounts. If in use, this could impede access by others on your behalf after death if they don't have access to either the Sync passphrase or an authorised device.

Intuitive Password

Emergency Contact
Overview
Website: https://www.intuitivepassword.com/en/Service/CompareEditions
Emergency contact functionality: Yes
Emergency kit functionality: Yes TBC
Password sharing functionality: Yes TBC
Emergency Contact Functionality
Mechanism: Dead man's switch of optional length initiated by emergency contact
Granularity: Three levels: No passwords; Unprotected passwords; All passwords
Objects that can be passed:
  • Passwords
  • TBC
Number of contacts possible: TBC
Types of accounts that can give access: Advanced/Pro Edition
Types of accounts that can receive access: Any
Emergency Contact Documentation
Account Recovery Functionality
Applicable subscriptions:
Requirements:
  • The emergency contact functionality (known in this case as Account Inheritance) can be used as a form of account recovery, according to the documentation.
  • Advanced/Pro Edition
  • Access to assigned recovery email address
  • Secret Key (created at assignment of beneficiary)
Account Recovery Documentation
Export formats
  • TBC
Notes
  • In addition to the main Intuitive password (known within most other password managers as a master password), there is the option to add a second password, referred to in the documentation as the master password. Especially private passwords or notes can be encrypted with this secondary password, protecting them from being seen when sharing or inheriting passwords. See more here: https://www.intuitivepassword.com/en/Support/UserManualManagePasswordsDoc003

LastPass

Emergency Contact
Password Sharing
Overview
Website: www.lastpass.com
Emergency contact functionality: Yes
Emergency kit functionality: No
Password sharing functionality: Yes
Emergency Contact Functionality
Mechanism: Dead man's switch of optional length initiated by emergency contact
Granularity: Full access to all credentials
Objects that can be passed:
Number of contacts possible: One or more
Types of accounts that can give access: Premium or Families
Types of accounts that can receive access: Any
Emergency Contact Documentation
Password Sharing Functionality
  • Any user can share items on an individual basis
  • Users part of Families, Teams or Enterprise/Identity subscriptions can create and share folders of credentials
Password Sharing Documentation
Export formats
  • CSV
  • xml
Notes
  • Recipient must accept, and then the granting account must confirm before the emergency contact setup is complete. This means that accepting the role of emergency contact must take place before the need for access arises.
  • Details on how the emergency contact functionality is secure is available here https://support.logmeininc.com/lastpass/help/how-is-emergency-access-secure
